ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Q12: The course was more about the design rather than the technical aspects of projects. Q9: The instructor is very nice and always responsive, but the lectures weren't very engaging.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The group work and the variety of projects was good.
Possibility to improve a real site

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think lecture could be split up a little bit more. Sometimes the class dragged on a bit.

More feedback/direction on the project would have helped. Workshop time should have been longer and more constructive. A narrower but deeper focus on a single project (instead of an entire site) would have been more useful.
Clearer instructions and more focus on one aspect of site sustainability rather than all of them

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Going through the sustainable design process is important for environmental students, even if they won't be sustainable design architects themselves.
I have interest in urban sustainability and this fits nicely into my background

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, this course made sustainable site design bite-sized and manageable.
No. It was a fun and interesting process, but I'm not sure what my final take away is.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I feel like some people didn't really pull their weight in group work (and I know the other parcel felt the same way). It was also hard to meet up sometimes because of different schedules and some students not living on campus.
Learned a lot from my teammates expertise and perspectives

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Solidify a plan of attack early on with your group. Also, do not let some group members slack.
